Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the zaddress is NOT visible on the blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can publish your zaddress on twitter, doesnt matter as long as you z_getoperationresult, it wipes all the send history from that zaddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on the receive side, all you have is the txid, amount and memo field

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no zaddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, if you give access to your wallet, then they can tell that you own the zaddress, in that case if the counterpart who sent to your zaddress did not z_getoperationresult, then they could link that transaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so basically if both your wallet and your counterpart's wallet are confiscated and the sender didnt z_getoperationresult, then can figure out what txid was sent from zaddr to zaddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mining via nicehash, the BTC you pay from is the biggest privacy leak

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: from a wise old man

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe many people assume that zaddr are visible on the blockchain like taddr are. they are not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the way it works is that each node has a set of zaddr/privkey pairs in their wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then for EVERY ztransaction, they try to decrypt it. if they can, it is a transaction for that wallet and it is processed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the zadddr exists in the blockchain only by being able to decrypt transactions encrypted to that zaddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
maybe many people assume that zaddr are visible on the blockchain like taddr are. they are not
the way it works is that each node has a set of zaddr/privkey pairs in their wallet
then for EVERY ztransaction, they try to decrypt it. if they can, it is a transaction for that wallet and it is processed
so the zadddr exists in the blockchain only by being able to decrypt transactions encrypted to that zaddr
